name: User / account
description: A user acccount, local or remote.

username.description: The username, without the domain part

acct.description: The user's account name as username@domain (@domain omitted for local users)

discoverable.description: Indicates whether or not a user is visible on the discovery page

group.description: A boolean indicating whether the account represents a group rather than an individual.

locked.description: Denotes whether the account can be followed without a follow request

version_history: now resolves to midnight instead of an exact time

following_count.description: How many accounts this account follows

followers_count.description: How many followers this account has

statuses_count.description: How many statuses this account has created, excluding: 1) later deleted posts 2) direct messages / 'mentined users only' posts, except in earlier versions mastodon.
version_history: no longer includes direct / mentioned-only visibility statuses

url.description: A URL pointing to this users profile page (can be remote)

avatar.description: URL for this users avatar, can be animated

header.description: URL for this users header image, can be animated

avatar_static.description: URL for this users avatar, never animated

header_static.description: URL for this users header image, never animated

moved_to_account.description: If set, Account that this user has set up as their moved-to address.

suspended.description: Boolean indicating whether the user has been suspended.

limited.description: Boolean indicating whether the user has been silenced.

bot.description: Boolean indicating whether this account is automated.

fields.description: List of up to four (by default) AccountFields

emojis.description: List of custom emoji used in name, bio or fields

last_status_at.description: When the most recent status was posted.
version_history: now returns date only, no time

noindex.description: Whether the local user has opted out of being indexed by search engines.

roles.description: Deprecated. Was a list of strings with the users roles. Now just an empty list. Mastodon.py makes no attempt to fill it, and the field may be removed if Mastodon removes it. Use the `role` field instead.

role.description: The users role. Only present for account returned from account_verify_credentials()

source.description: Additional information about the account, useful for profile editing. Only present for account returned from account_verify_credentials()

mute_expires_at.description: If the user is muted by the logged in user with a timed mute, when the mute expires.

name: Account field
description: A field, displayed on a users profile (e.g. "Pronouns", "Favorite color").

name.description: The key of a given field's key-value pair.

value.description: The value associated with the `name` key.

verified_at.description: Timestamp of when the server verified a URL value for a rel="me" link.

name: Account role
description: A role granting a user a set of permissions.

id.description: The ID of the Role in the database.

permissions.description: A bitmask that represents the sum of all permissions granted to the role.

color.description: The hex code assigned to this role. If no hex code is assigned, the string will be empty.

highlighted.description: Whether the role is publicly visible as a badge on user profiles.

name: User / account source
description: Source values useful for editing a user's profile.

privacy.description: The user's default visibility setting ("private", "unlisted" or "public")

sensitive.description: Denotes whether user media should be marked sensitive by default

note.description: Plain text version of the user's bio

language.description: The default posting language for new statuses.

follow_requests_count.description: The number of pending follow requests.

name: Toot / Status
description: A single status / toot / post

in_reply_to_id.description: Id of the status this status is in response to

in_reply_to_account_id.description: Id of the account this status is in response to

reblog.description: Denotes whether the status is a reblog. If so, set to the original status.

content.description:
Content of the status, as HTML: '

Hello from Python

'

reblogged.description: Denotes whether the logged in user has boosted this status

favourited.description: Denotes whether the logged in user has favourited this status

sensitive.description: Denotes whether media attachments to the status are marked sensitive

spoiler_text.description: Warning text that should be displayed before the status content

enum.public: Publicly visible and discoverable in public timelines
enum.unlisted: Publicly visible, but not shown on public timelines and other discovery tools
enum.direct: Visible only to people mentioned in the status
enum.list: Visible only to people on a manually curated list (pleroma-specific)

mentions.description: A list Mentions this status includes

media_attachments.description: List files attached to this status

emojis.description: A list of CustomEmoji used in the status

tags.description: A list of Tags used in the status

bookmarked.description: True if the status is bookmarked by the logged in user, False if not.

application.description: Application for the client used to post the status (Does not federate and is therefore always None for remote statuses, can also be None for local statuses for some legacy applications registered before this field was introduced).

language.description: The language of the status, if specified by the server, as ISO 639-1 (two-letter) language code.

muted.description: Boolean denoting whether the user has muted this status by way of conversation muting

pinned.description: Boolean denoting whether or not the status is currently pinned for the associated account.

replies_count.description: The number of replies to this status.

card.description: A preview card for links from the status, if present at time of delivery.

poll.description: A poll object if a poll is attached to this status.

edited_at.description: Time the status was last edited

filtered.description: If present, a list of filter application results that indicate which of the users filters matched and what actions should be taken.

name: Status edit
description: An object representing a past version of an edited status

content.description: Content for this version of the status

spoiler_text.description: CW / Spoiler text for this version of the status

sensitive.description: Whether media in this version of the status is marked as sensitive

created_at.description: Time at which this version of the status was posted

account.description: Account object of the user that posted the status

media_attachments.description: List of MediaAttachment objects with the attached media for this version of the status

emojis.description: List of custom emoji used in this version of the status.

poll.description: The current state of the poll options at this revision. Note that edits changing the poll options will be collapsed together into one edit, since this action resets the poll.

name: Status filter action
description: A filter action that should be taken on a status.

keyword_matches.description: The keyword within the filter that was matched.

status_matches.description: The status ID within the filter that was matched.

name: Mention
description: A mention of a user within a status

username.description: Mentioned user's user name (not including domain)

name: Scheduled status / toot
func_call_real: mastodon.status_post("posting in the far future", scheduled_at=datetime(2100,12,12))
description: A scheduled status / toot to be eventually posted.

id.description: Scheduled status ID (note: Not the id of the status once it gets posted!)

scheduled_at.description: datetime object describing when the status is to be posted

params.description: Parameters for the scheduled status, specifically

media_attachments.description: Array of MediaAttachment objects for the attachments to the scheduled status

name: Scheduled status / toot params
func_call_real: mastodon.status_post("posting in the far future", scheduled_at=datetime(2100,12,12)).params
description: Parameters for a status / toot to be posted in the future.

in_reply_to_id.description: ID of the status this one is a reply to

media_ids.description: IDs of media attached to this status

sensitive.description: Whether this status is sensitive or not

idempotency.description: Idempotency key for the scheduled status

scheduled_at.description: Present, but generally "None". Unsure what this is for - the actual scheduled_at is in the ScheduledStatus object, not here. If you know, let me know.

application_id.description: ID of the application that scheduled the status

language.description: The language that will be used for the status.

allowed_mentions.description: Undocumented. If you know what this does, please let me know.

with_rate_limit.description: Whether the status should be rate limited. It is unclear to me what this does. If you know, please let met know

name: Poll
description: A poll attached to a status

expires_at.description: The time at which the poll is set to expire

expired.description: Boolean denoting whether users can still vote in this poll

multiple.description: Boolean indicating whether it is allowed to vote for more than one option

votes_count.description: Total number of votes cast in this poll

voted.description: Boolean indicating whether the logged-in user has already voted in this poll

emojis.description: List of CustomEmoji used in answer strings,

own_votes.description: The logged-in users votes, as a list of indices to the options.

voters_count.description: How many unique accounts have voted on a multiple-choice poll.

name: Poll option
description: A poll option within a poll

votes_count.description: Count of votes for the option. Can be None if the poll creator has chosen to hide vote totals until the poll expires and it hasn't yet.

name: Conversation
description: A conversation (using direct / mentions-only visibility) between two or more users

id.description: The ID of this conversation object

unread.description: Boolean indicating whether this conversation has yet to be read by the user

accounts.description: List of accounts (other than the logged-in account) that are part of this conversation

last_status.description: The newest status in this conversation

name: Hashtag
description: A hashtag, as part of a status or on its own (e.g. trending)

history.description: List of TagHistory for up to 7 days. Not present in statuses.

following.description: Boolean indicating whether the logged-in user is following this tag.

name: Hashtag usage history
description: Usage history for a hashtag

day.description: Date of the day this TagHistory is for

uses.description: Number of statuses using this hashtag on that day

accounts.description: Number of accounts using this hashtag in at least one status on that day

name: Emoji
description: A custom emoji

url.description: URL for the emoji image, can be animated

static_url.description: URL for the emoji image, never animated

visible_in_picker.description: True if the emoji is enabled, False if not.

category.description: The category to display the emoji under (not present if none is set)

name: Application
description: Information about an app (in terms of the API)

vapid_key.description: A vapid key that can be used in web applications

name: Relationship
description: Information about the relationship between two users

following.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user follows the specified user

followed_by.description: Boolean denoting whether the specified user follows the logged-in user

blocking.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user has blocked the specified user

blocked_by.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user has been blocked by the specified user, if information is available

muting.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user has muted the specified user

muting_notifications.description: Boolean denoting wheter the logged-in user has muted notifications related to the specified user

requested.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user has sent the specified user a follow request

domain_blocking.description: Boolean denoting whether the logged-in user has blocked the specified users domain

showing_reblogs.description: Boolean denoting whether the specified users reblogs show up on the logged-in users Timeline

endorsed.description: Boolean denoting wheter the specified user is being endorsed / featured by the logged-in user

note.description: A free text note the logged in user has created for this account (not publicly visible)

notifying.description: Boolean indicating whether the logged-in user has enabled notifications for this users posts

languages.description: List of languages that the logged in user is following this user for (if any)

requested_by.description: Boolean indicating whether the specified user has sent the logged-in user a follow request

name: Filter (v1)
description: Information about a keyword / status filter

context.description: List of places where the filters are applied.

enum.thread: Expanded view of a status with replies
enum.account: Posts displayed when viewing a profile

irreversible.description: Boolean denoting if this filter is executed server-side or if it should be ran client-side.

whole_word.description: Boolean denoting whether this filter can match partial words

name: Filter (v2)
description: Information about a keyword / status filter

context.description: List of places where the filters are applied.

enum.thread: Expanded view of a status with replies
enum.account: Posts displayed when viewing a profile

title.description: Name the user has chosen for this filter

filter_action.description: The action to be taken when a status matches this filter.

enum.warn: Display a note to the user that the status has been filtered, showing the title of the filter. The mastodon documentation suggests that absent any other information or if unknown values are encountered, this should be the default action to take.
enum.hide: Hide the status from the user completely, as if it did not exist

keywords.description: A list of keywords that will trigger this filter.

statuses.description: A list of statuses that will trigger this filter.

name: Notification
description: A notification about some event, like a new reply or follower.

created_at.description: The time the notification was created

account.description: Account of the user from whom the notification originates

status.description: In case of "mention", the mentioning status In case of reblog / favourite, the reblogged / favourited status

name: Context
description: The conversation context for a given status, i.e. its predecessors (that it replies to) and successors (that reply to it).

ancestors.description: A list of Statuses that the Status with this Context is a reply to

descendants.description: A list of Statuses that are replies to the Status with this Context

name: User List
description: A list of users

replies_policy.description: Which replies should be shown in the list.

name: Media attachment
description: A piece of media (like an image, video, or audio file) that can be or has been attached to a status.

url.description: The URL for the image in the local cache

remote_url.description: The remote URL for the media (if the image is from a remote instance)

preview_url.description: The URL for the media preview

text_url.description: Deprecated. The display text for the media (what shows up in text). May not be present in mastodon versions after 3.5.0

meta.description: MediaAttachmentMetadataContainer that contains metadata for 'original' and 'small' (preview) versions of the MediaAttachment. Either may be empty. May additionally contain an "fps" field giving a videos frames per second (possibly rounded), and a "length" field giving a videos length in a human-readable format. Note that a video may have an image as preview. May also contain a 'focus' object and a media 'colors' object.

blurhash.description: The blurhash for the image, used for preview / placeholder generation

description.description: If set, the user-provided description for this media.

preview_remote_url.description: If set, the remote URL for the thumbnail of this media attachment on the or originating instance.

name: Media metadata container
description: An object holding metadata about a media attachment and its thumbnail.

original.description: Metadata for the original media attachment

small.description: Metadata for the thumbnail of this media attachment.

colors.description: Information about accent colors for the media.

focus.description: Information about the focus point for the media.

name: Media image metadata
description: Metadata for an image media attachment.

width.description: Width of the image in pixels

height.description: Height of the image in pixels

aspect.description: Aspect ratio of the image as a floating point number

size.description: Textual representation of the image size in pixels, e.g. '800x600'

name: Media video and gifv metadata
description: Metadata for a video or gifv media attachment.

width.description: Width of the video in pixels

height.description: Height of the video in pixels

frame_rate.description: Exact frame rate of the video in frames per second. Can be an integer fraction (i.e. "20/7")

duration.description: Duration of the video in seconds

bitrate.description: Average bit-rate of the video in bytes per second

name: Media audio metadata
description: Metadata for an audio media attachment.

duration.description: Duration of the audio file in seconds

bitrate.description: Average bit-rate of the audio file in bytes per second

name: Media focus point
description: The focus point for a media attachment, for cropping purposes.

x.description: Focus point x coordinate (between -1 and 1), with 0 being the center and -1 and 1 being the left and right edges respectively.

y.description: Focus point x coordinate (between -1 and 1), with 0 being the center and -1 and 1 being the upper and lower edges respectively.

name: Media colors
description: Object describing the accent colors for a media attachment.

foreground.description: Estimated foreground colour for the attachment thumbnail, as a html format hex color (#rrggbb)

background.description: Estimated background colour for the attachment thumbnail, as a html format hex color (#rrggbb)

accent.description: Estimated accent colour for the attachment thumbnail

name: Card
description: A preview card attached to a status, e.g. for an embedded video or link.

enum.rich: iframe OEmbed. Not currently accepted, so won't show up in practice.

image.description: (optional) The image associated with the card.

author_name.description: Name of the embedded contents author

author_url.description: URL pointing to the embedded contents author

provider_name.description: Name of the provider from which the embed originates

provider_url.description: URL pointing to the embeds provider

embed_url.description: Used for photo embeds, instead of custom `html`.

name: Search result (v1)
description: A search result, with accounts, hashtags and statuses.

accounts.description: List of Accounts resulting from the query

hashtags.description: List of Tags resulting from the query
version_history: v1 search deprecated because it returns a list of strings. v2 search added which returns a list of tags.

statuses.description: List of Statuses resulting from the query

name: Search result (v2)
description: A search result, with accounts, hashtags and statuses.

accounts.description: List of Accounts resulting from the query

hashtags.description: List of Tags resulting from the query

statuses.description: List of Statuses resulting from the query

name: Instance (v1)
description: Information about an instance. V1 API version.

uri.description: The instance's domain name. Moved to 'domain' for the v2 API, though Mastodon.py will mirror it here for backwards compatibility.

short_description.description: An very brief text only instance description. Moved to 'description' for the v2 API.

description.description: A brief instance description set by the admin. The V1 variant could contain html, but this is now deprecated. Likely to be empty on many instances.

email.description: The admin contact email. Moved to InstanceContacts for the v2 API, though Mastodon.py will mirror it here for backwards compatibility.

version.description: The instance's Mastodon version. For a more robust parsed major/minor/patch version see TODO IMPLEMENT FUNCTION TO RETURN VERSIONS

urls.description: Additional InstanceURLs, in the v1 api version likely to be just 'streaming_api' with the stream server websocket address.

stats.description: InstanceStatistics containing three stats, user_count (number of local users), status_count (number of local statuses) and domain_count (number of known instance domains other than this one). This information is not present in the v2 API variant in this form - there is a 'usage' field instead.

thumbnail.description: Information about thumbnails to represent the instance. In the v1 API variant, simply an URL pointing to a banner image representing the instance. The v2 API provides a more complex structure with a list of thumbnails of different sizes in this field.

languages.description: Array of ISO 639-1 (two-letter) language codes the instance has chosen to advertise.

registrations.description: A boolean indication whether registrations on this instance are open (True) or not (False). The v2 API variant instead provides a dict with more information about possible registration requirements here.

approval_required.description: True if account approval is required when registering, False if not. Moved to InstanceRegistrations object for the v2 API.

invites_enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether invites are enabled on this instance. Changed in 4.0.0 from being true when the instance setting to enable invites is true to be true when the default user role has invites enabled (i.e. everyone can invite people). The v2 API does not contain this field, and it is not clear whether it will stay around.
version_history: changed specifics of when field is true, deprecated

configuration.description: Various instance configuration settings - especially various limits (character counts, media upload sizes, ...)

contact_account.description: Account of the primary contact for the instance. Moved to InstanceContacts for the v2 API.

rules.description: List of Rules with `id` and `text` fields, one for each server rule set by the admin

name: Instance configuration (v1)
description: Configuration values for this instance, especially limits and enabled features.

name: Instance urls (v1)
description: A list of URLs related to an instance.

streaming_api.description: The Websockets URL for connecting to the streaming API. Renamed to 'streaming' for the v2 API.

name: Instance (v2)
description: Information about an instance

version.description: The instance's Mastodon version. For a more robust parsed major/minor/patch version see TODO IMPLEMENT FUNCTION TO RETURN VERSIONS

source_url.description: URL pointing to a copy of the source code that is used to run this instance. For Mastodon instances, the AGPL requires that this code be available.

description.description: A brief instance description set by the admin. Contains what in the v1 version was the short description.

usage.description: Information about recent activity on this instance.

thumbnail.description: Information about thumbnails to represent the instance.

languages.description: Array of ISO 639-1 (two-letter) language codes the instance has chosen to advertise.

configuration.description: Various instance configuration settings - especially various limits (character counts, media upload sizes, ...)

registrations.description: InstanceRegistrations object with information about how users can sign up on this instance.

rules.description: List of Rules with `id` and `text` fields, one for each server rule set by the admin

name: Instance configuration (v2)
description: Configuration values for this instance, especially limits and enabled features.

translation.description: Translation-related instance configuration fields. Only present for the v2 API variant of the instance API.

urls.description: Instance related URLs. Only present for the v2 API variant of the instance API.

name: Instance urls (v2)
description: A list of URLs related to an instance.

streaming.description: The Websockets URL for connecting to the streaming API.

status.description: If present, a URL where the status and possibly current issues with the instance can be checked.

name: Instance thumbnail
description: Extended information about an instances thumbnail.

url.description: The URL for an image representing the instance.

blurhash.description: The blurhash for the image representing the instance.

versions.description: Different resolution versions of the image representing the instance.

name: Instance thumbnail versions
description: Different resolution versions of the image representing the instance.

@1x.description: The URL for an image representing the instance, for devices with 1x resolution / 96 dpi

@2x.description: The URL for the image representing the instance, for devices with 2x resolution / 192 dpi

name: Instance statistics
description: Usage statistics for an instance.

user_count.description: The total number of accounts that have been created on this instance.

status_count.description: The total number of local posts that have been made on this instance.

domain_count.description: The total number of other instances that this instance is aware of.

name: Instance usage
description: Usage / recent activity information for this instance.

users.description: Information about user counts on this instance.

name: Instance usage user information
description: Recent active user information about this instance.

active_month.description: This instances most recent monthly active user count.

name: Instance rule
description: A rule that instance staff has specified users must follow on this instance.

name: Instance registration information
description: Registration information for this instance, like whether registrations are open and whether they require approval.

approval_required.description: Boolean indicating whether registrations on the instance require approval.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether registrations are enabled on this instance.

message.description: A message to be shown instead of the sign-up form when registrations are closed.

url.description: Presumably, a registration related URL. It is unclear what this is for.

name: Instance contact information
description: Contact information for this instances' staff.

account.description: Account that has been designated as the instances contact account.

email.description: E-mail address that can be used to contact the instance staff.

name: Instance account configuration
description: Configuration values relating to accounts.

max_featured_tags.description: The maximum number of featured tags that can be displayed on a profile.

name: Instance status configuration
description: Configuration values relating to statuses.

max_characters.description: Maximum number of characters in a status this instance allows local users to use.

max_media_attachments.description: Maximum number of media attachments per status this instance allows local users to use.

characters_reserved_per_url.description: Number of characters that this instance counts a URL as when counting charaters.

name: Instance translation configuration
description: Configuration values relating to translation.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the translation API is enabled on this instance.

name: Instance media attachment configuration
description: Configuration values relating to media attachments.

supported_mime_types.description: Mime types the instance accepts for media attachment uploads.

image_size_limit.description: Maximum size (in bytes) the instance will accept for image uploads.

image_matrix_limit.description: Maximum total number of pixels (i.e. width * height) the instance will accept for image uploads.

video_size_limit.description: Maximum size (in bytes) the instance will accept for video uploads

video_frame_rate_limit.description: Maximum frame rate the instance will accept for video uploads

video_matrix_limit.description: Maximum total number of pixels (i.e. width * height) the instance will accept for video uploads

name: Instance poll configuration
description: Configuration values relating to polls.

max_options.description: How many poll options this instance allows local users to use per poll

max_characters_per_option.description: Maximum number of characters this instance allows local users to use per poll option

min_expiration.description: The shortest allowed duration for a poll on this instance, in seconds

max_expiration.description: The longest allowed duration for a poll on this instance, in seconds

name: Nodeinfo
description: The instances standardized NodeInfo data.

version.description: Version of the nodeinfo schema spec that was used for this response.

software.description: Information about the server software being used on this instance.

protocols.description: A list of strings specifying the federation protocols this instance supports. Typically, just "activitypub".

services.description: Services that this instance can retrieve messages from or send messages to.

usage.description: Information about recent activity on this instance.

openRegistrations.description: Bool indicating whether the instance is open for registrations.

metadata.description: Additional node metadata. On Mastodon, typically an empty object with no fields.

name: Nodeinfo software
description: NodeInfo software-related information.

name.description: Name of the software used by this instance.

version.description: String indicating the version of the software used by this instance.

name: Nodeinfo services
description: Nodeinfo services-related information.

outbound.description: List of services that this instance can send messages to. On Mastodon, typically an empty list.

inbound.description: List of services that this instance can retrieve messages from. On Mastodon, typically an empty list.

name: Nodeinfo usage
description: Nodeinfo usage-related information.

users.description: Information about user counts on this instance.

localPosts.description: The total number of local posts that have been made on this instance.

name: Nodeinfo usage user count
description: Nodeinfo user count statistics.

total.description: The total number of accounts that have been created on this instance.

activeMonth.description: Number of users that have been active, by some definition (Mastodon: Have logged in at least once) in the last month.

activeHalfyear.description: Number of users that have been active, by some definition (Mastodon: Have logged in at least once) in the last half year.

name: Nodeinfo metadata
description: Nodeinfo extra metadata.

name: Activity
description: Information about recent activity on an instance.

week.description: Date of the first day of the week the stats were collected for

logins.description: Number of users that logged in that week

registrations.description: Number of new users that week

statuses.description: Number of statuses posted that week

name: Report
description: Information about a report that has been filed against a user. Currently largely pointless, as updated reports cannot be fetched.

action_taken.description: True if a moderator or admin has processed the report, False otherwise.

comment.description: Text comment submitted with the report

created_at.description: Time at which this report was created, as a datetime object

target_account.description: Account that has been reported with this report

status_ids.description: List of status IDs attached to the report

action_taken_at.description: When an action was taken, if this report is currently resolved.

category.description: The category under which the report is classified.

forwarded.description: Whether a report was forwarded to a remote instance.

rules_ids.description: IDs of the rules selected for this report.

name: Admin report
description: Information about a report that has been filed against a user.

action_taken.description: True if a moderator or admin has processed the report, False otherwise.

comment.description: Text comment submitted with the report

created_at.description: Time at which this report was created, as a datetime object

updated_at.description: Last time this report has been updated, as a datetime object

account.description: Account of the user that filed this report

target_account.description: Account that has been reported with this report

assigned_account.description: If the report as been assigned to an account, that Account (None if not)

statuses.description: List of Statuses attached to the report

action_taken_at.description: When an action was taken, if this report is currently resolved.

category.description: The category under which the report is classified.

forwarded.description: Whether a report was forwarded to a remote instance.

rules.description: Rules attached to the report, for context.

name: Push subscription
description: Information about the logged-in users web push subscription for the authenticated application.

server_key.description: Server pubkey used for signature verification

alerts.description: Subscribed events - object that may contain various keys, with value True if webpushes have been requested for those events.

enum.follower: Pushes should be generated for events originating from accounts that follow the logged in user.
enum.followed: Pushes should be generated for events originating from accounts the logged in user follows.

name: Push subscription alert
description: Information about alerts as part of a push subscription.

follow.description: True if push subscriptions for follow events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

favourite.description: True if push subscriptions for favourite events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

reblog.description: True if push subscriptions for reblog events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

mention.description: True if push subscriptions for mention events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

poll.description: True if push subscriptions for poll events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

follow_request.description: True if push subscriptions for follow request events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

status.description: True if push subscriptions for status creation (watched users only) events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

update.description: True if push subscriptions for status update (edit) events have been requested, false or not present otherwise.

admin_sign_up.description: True if push subscriptions for sign up events have been requested, false or not present otherwise. Admins only.

admin_report.description: True if push subscriptions for report creation events have been requested, false or not present otherwise. Admins only.

name: Push notification
description: A single Mastodon push notification received via WebPush, after decryption.

access_token.description: Access token that can be used to access the API as the notified user

icon.description: URL to an icon for the notification

notification_id.description: ID that can be passed to notification() to get the full notification object,

notification_type.description: String indicating the type of notification.

enum.follow: A user followed the logged in user.
enum.favourite: A user favourited one of the logged in user's statuses.
enum.reblog: A user reblogged one of the logged in user's statuses.
enum.mention: A user mentioned the logged in user in a status.
enum.poll: A poll created or participated in by the logged in user has updated or ended
enum.follow_request: A user has requested to follow the logged in user.
enum.status: A watched user has posted a new status.
enum.update: A status the logged in user has reblogged has been edited.
enum.admin_sign_up: A new user has signed up on the instance.
enum.admin_report: A user has been reported to the instance's administrators.

name: Preference
description: The logged in users preferences.

posting:default:visibility.description: Default visibility for new posts. Also found in CredentialAccountSource as `privacy`.

posting:default:sensitive.description: Default sensitivity flag for new posts. Also found in CredentialAccountSource as `sensitive`.

posting:default:language.description: Default language for new posts. Also found in CredentialAccountSource as `language`.

reading:expand:media.description: String indicating whether media attachments should be automatically displayed or blurred/hidden.

enum.show_all: Always show all media by default, regardless of sensitivity
enum.hide_all: Always hide all media by default, regardless of sensitivity

reading:expand:spoilers.description: Boolean indicating whether CWs should be expanded by default.

reading:autoplay:gifs.description: Boolean indicating whether gifs should be autoplayed (True) or not (False)

name: Featured tag
description: A tag featured on a users profile.

statuses_count.description: Number of publicly visible statuses posted with this hashtag that this instance knows about

last_status_at.description: The last time a public status containing this hashtag was added to this instance's database (can be None if there are none)

url.description: A link to all statuses by a user that contain this hashtag.

name: Read marker
description: A read marker indicating where the logged in user has left off reading a given timeline.

last_read_id.description: ID of the last read object in the timeline

version.description: A counter that is incremented whenever the marker is set to a new status

updated_at.description: The time the marker was last set, as a datetime object

name: Announcement
description: An announcement sent by the instances staff.

content.description: The contents of the annoucement, as an html string

starts_at.description: The annoucements start time, as a datetime object. Can be None

ends_at.description: The annoucements end time, as a datetime object. Can be None

all_day.description: Boolean indicating whether the annoucement represents an "all day" event

published_at.description: The annoucements publish time, as a datetime object

updated_at.description: The annoucements last updated time, as a datetime object

read.description: A boolean indicating whether the logged in user has dismissed the annoucement

emojis.description: Custom emoji used in the annoucement

statuses.description: Statuses linked in the announcement text.

name: Announcement reaction
description: A reaction to an announcement.

name.description: Name of the custom emoji or unicode emoji of the reaction

count.description: Reaction counter (i.e. number of users who have added this reaction)

me.description: True if the logged-in user has reacted with this emoji, false otherwise

url.description: URL for the custom emoji image

static_url.description: URL for a never-animated version of the custom emoji image

name: Announcement reaction (streaming edition)
description: A reaction to an announcement.

name.description: Name of the custom emoji or unicode emoji of the reaction

count.description: Reaction counter (i.e. number of users who have added this reaction)

announcement_id.description: If of the announcement this reaction was for

name: Familiar follower
description: A follower of a given account that is also followed by the logged-in user.

id.description: ID of the account for which the familiar followers are being returned

accounts.description: List of Accounts of the familiar followers

name: Admin account
description: Admin variant of the Account entity, with some additional information.

email.description: For local users, the user's email

ip.description: For local users, the user's last known IP address
version_history: return type changed from String to [AdminIp]({{< relref "entities/Admin_Ip" >}}) due to a bug
bug fixed, return type is now a String again

confirmed.description: For local users, False if the user has not confirmed their email, True otherwise

suspended.description: Boolean indicating whether the user has been suspended

silenced.description: Boolean indicating whether the user has been silenced

disabled.description: For local users, boolean indicating whether the user has had their login disabled

approved.description: For local users, False if the user is pending, True otherwise

locale.description: For local users, the locale the user has set,

invite_request.description: If the user requested an invite, the invite request comment of that user.

sensitized.description: Undocumented. If you know what this means, please let me know.

ips.description: All known IP addresses associated with this account.

created_by_application_id.description: Present if the user was created by an application and set to the application id.

invited_by_account_id.description: Present if the user was created via invite and set to the inviting users id.

name: Admin account IP
description: An IP address used by some user or other instance, visible as part of some admin APIs.

used_at.description: The timestamp of when the IP address was last used for this account.

name: Admin measure
description: A measurement, such as the number of active users, as returned by the admin reporting API.

enum.active_users: Total active users on your instance within the time period
enum.new_users: Users who joined your instance within the time period
enum.interactions: Total interactions (favourites, boosts, replies) on local statuses within the time period
enum.opened_reports: Total reports filed within the time period
enum.resolved_reports: Total reports resolved within the time period
enum.tag_accounts: Total accounts who used a tag in at least one status within the time period
enum.tag_uses: Total statuses which used a tag within the time period
enum.tag_servers: Total remote origin servers for statuses which used a tag within the time period
enum.instance_accounts: Total accounts originating from a remote domain within the time period
enum.instance_media_attachments: Total space used by media attachments from a remote domain within the time period
enum.instance_reports: Total reports filed against accounts from a remote domain within the time period
enum.instance_statuses: Total statuses originating from a remote domain within the time period
enum.instance_follows: Total accounts from a remote domain followed by a local user within the time period
enum.instance_followers: Total local accounts followed by accounts from a remote domain within the time period

unit.description: Unit for the measure, if available

human_value.description: Human readable variant of the measure returned

previous_total.description: Previous measurement period value of the measure returned, if available

data.description: A list of AdminMeasureData with the measure broken down by date

name: Admin measure data
description: A single row of data for an admin reporting api measurement.

value.description: Value of the measure for this row

name: Admin dimension
description: A qualitative measurement about the server, as returned by the admin reporting api.

data.description: A list of data AdminDimensionData objects

name: Admin dimension data
description: A single row of data for qualitative measurements about the server, as returned by the admin reporting api.

human_key.description: Human readable name for the category for this row, when available

name: Admin retention
description: User retention data for a given cohort, as returned by the admin reporting api.

period.description: Starting time of the period that the data is being returned for

frequency.description: Time resolution (day or month) for the returned data

name: Admin retention data
description: A single data point regarding user retention for a given cohort, as returned by the admin reporting api.

name: Admin domain block
description: A domain block, as returned by the admin API.

id.description: The ID of the DomainBlock in the database.

domain.description: The domain that is not allowed to federate.

created_at.description: When the domain was blocked from federating.

severity.description: The policy to be applied by this domain block.

enum.silence: Users from this domain will be hidden from timelines, threads, and notifications, except for followed users.
enum.suspend: Incoming messages from this domain will be rejected and dropped entirely.
enum.noop: Do nothing to statuses. May be used to only media-reject or report-reject.

reject_media.description: Whether to reject media attachments from this domain

reject_reports.description: Whether to reject reports from this domain

private_comment.description: A private comment (visible only to other moderators) for the domain block

public_comment.description: A public comment (visible to either all users, or the whole world) for the domain block

obfuscate.description: Whether to obfuscate public displays of this domain block

name: Admin email block
description: An e-mail block that has been set up to prevent certain e-mails to be used when signing up, via hash matching.

id.description: The ID of the email block in the database.

canonical_email_hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the canonical email address.

name: Admin domain allow
description: The opposite of a domain block, specifically allowing a domain to federate when the instance is in allowlist mode.

id.description: The ID of the DomainAllow in the database.

domain.description: The domain that is allowed to federate.

created_at.description: When the domain was allowed to federate.

name: Admin email domain block
description: A block that has been set up to prevent e-mails from certain domains to be used when signing up.

id.description: The ID of the EmailDomainBlock in the database.

domain.description: The email domain that is not allowed to be used for signups.

created_at.description: When the email domain was disallowed from signups.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

name: Admin email signup attempt history
description: Historic data about attempted signups using e-mails from a given domain.

day.description: The time (in day increments) for which this row of historical data is valid.

accounts.description: The number of different account creation attempts that have been made.

uses.description: The number of different ips used in account creation attempts.

name: Admin IP block
description: An admin IP block, to prevent certain IP addresses or address ranges from accessing the instance.

id.description: The ID of the DomainBlock in the database.

ip.description: The IP address range that is not allowed to federate.

severity.description: The associated policy with this IP block.

enum.sign_up_requires_approval: Any signup from this IP range will create a pending account
enum.sign_up_block: Any signup from this IP range will be rejected
enum.no_access: Any activity from this IP range will be rejected entirely

comment.description: The recorded reason for this IP block.

created_at.description: When the IP block was created.

expires_at.description: When the IP block will expire.

name: Domain block
description: A domain block that has been implemented by instance staff, limiting the way posts from the blocked instance are handled.

domain.description: The domain which is blocked. This may be obfuscated or partially censored.

digest.description: The SHA256 hash digest of the domain string.

severity.description: The level to which the domain is blocked.

enum.silence: Users from this domain will be hidden from timelines, threads, and notifications, except for followed users.
enum.suspend: Incoming messages from this domain will be rejected and dropped entirely.

comment.description: An optional reason for the domain block.

name: Extended instance description
description: An extended instance description that can contain HTML.

updated_at.description: A timestamp of when the extended description was last updated.

content.description: The rendered HTML content of the extended description.

name: Filter keyword
description: A keyword that is being matched as part of a filter.

id.description: The ID of the FilterKeyword in the database.

keyword.description: The phrase to be matched against.

whole_word.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See implementation guidelines for filters().

name: Filter status
description: A single status that is being matched as part of a filter.

id.description: The ID of the FilterStatus in the database.

status_id.description: The ID of the Status that will be filtered.

name: Identity proof
description: A cryptographic proof-of-identity.

provider.description: The name of the identity provider.

provider_username.description: The account owner's username on the identity provider's service.

updated_at.description: When the identity proof was last updated.

proof_url.description: A link to a statement of identity proof, hosted by the identity provider.

profile_url.description: The account owner's profile URL on the identity provider.

name: Status source
description: The source data of a status, useful when editing a status.

id.description: ID of the status in the database.

text.description: The plain text used to compose the status.

spoiler_text.description: The plain text used to compose the status's subject or content warning.

name: Suggestion
description: A follow suggestion.

source.description: The reason this account is being suggested.

account.description: The account being recommended to follow.

name: Translation
description: A translation of a status.

content.description: The translated text of the status.

detected_source_language.description: The language of the source text, as auto-detected by the machine translation provider.

provider.description: The service that provided the machine translation.

name: Account creation error
description: An error response returned when creating an account fails.

error.description: The error as a localized string.

details.description: A dictionary giving more details about what fields caused errors and in which ways.

name: Account creation error details
description: An object containing detailed errors for different fields in the account creation attempt.

username.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the username.

password.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the password.

email.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the e-mail.

agreement.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the usage policy agreement.

locale.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the locale.

reason.description: An object giving more details about an error caused by the registration reason.

name: Account creation error details field
description: An object giving details about what specifically is wrong with a given field in an account registration attempt.

error.description: A machine readable string giving an error category.

enum.ERR_UNREACHABLE: e-mail address does not resolve to any IP via DNS (MX, A, AAAA)
enum.ERR_TAKEN: username or e-mail are already taken
enum.ERR_INVALID: an attribute is malformed, e.g. wrong characters or invalid e-mail address
enum.ERR_TOO_LONG: an attribute is over the character limit
enum.ERR_TOO_SHORT: an attribute is under the character requirement
enum.ERR_INCLUSION: an attribute is not one of the allowed values, e.g. unsupported locale

description.description: A description of the issue as a localized string.
